image.alt: Smiling girl with bright smile at Forever Smiles Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Forever Smiles Orthodontics is the premier private practice of Dr. Daniel Camacho, the only Board‑Certified orthodontist in Fort Lauderdale, FL. We follow a three‑pronged, patient‑centered approach: esthetics‑driven, evidence‑based, and boutique‑style care.
Founded to deliver personalized attention and consistently excellent results, our team focuses on creating beautiful, stable smiles while offering flexible financing and in‑network insurance options.

items.title: Esthetics-Driven
items.text: Our primary objective is to design natural, beautiful smiles using proven smile‑design principles.

items.title: Boutique Practice
items.text: A low‑volume, patient‑centered model gives you individualized time and focused attention at every visit.

items.title: Evidence-Based
items.text: Treatment plans and protocols are guided by current scientific evidence for efficient, long‑lasting results.

items.title: Flexible Fees
items.text: Multiple treatment options and flexible financing help make care affordable without compromising quality.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Daniel Camacho is a Board‑Certified orthodontist and adjunct professor of orthodontics who leads Forever Smiles Orthodontics in Fort Lauderdale, FL. Trained in evidence‑based orthodontics, he completed his dental education and specialty residency in orthodontics and dentofacial orthopedics, and he continues advanced training in Invisalign<sup>®</sup> and Pitts 21 techniques. Dr. Camacho combines clinical excellence with a personal, boutique approach to care.

image.alt: Dr. Daniel Camacho, Board‑Certified orthodontist at Forever Smiles Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: We offer modern braces, Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, and a complimentary first‑visit consultation so you can explore options, timelines, and financing with confidence.

og_meta.title: Forever Smiles Orthodontics — Fort Lauderdale
og_meta.description: Board‑Certified orthodontics by Dr. Daniel Camacho. Modern braces, Invisalign®, and boutique, patient‑centered care.

image.alt: Young patient smiling in a bright orthodontic office

paragraphs.text: We practice esthetic-driven orthodontics, putting beautiful, natural-looking smiles at the center of every treatment plan.
As a low-volume, patient-centered practice, we give each patient the time and attention they deserve, creating a boutique experience that feels comfortable and personal.
All treatment protocols are evidence-based, selected for their proven efficacy, efficiency, and long-term stability.
We take a three-pronged approach—esthetic-driven, evidence-based, and patient-centered care—delivering customized treatment and building lasting relationships with patients and the community.

image.alt: Dr. Daniel Camacho headshot

paragraphs.text: Dr. Daniel Camacho is a Board Certified orthodontist and an adjunct professor of orthodontics who brings a passion for esthetic, evidence-based care to Forever Smiles Orthodontics. He focuses on delivering individualized treatment plans that balance facial esthetics, function, and long-term stability.

Dr. Camacho combines clinical expertise with modern digital diagnostics and smile-design principles to offer both braces and Invisalign<sup>®</sup> when appropriate, always tailored to each patient’s goals and lifestyle.

image.alt: Dr. Daniel Camacho smiling in office

paragraphs.text: Dr. Camacho earned a Bachelor of Science in Molecular and Cell Biology at the University of Connecticut, graduating magna cum laude with honors. He completed his dental degree at the University of Connecticut School of Dental Medicine, finishing with the highest GPA in his class, and completed a 30-month orthodontic residency at Seton Hill University where he received a certificate in orthodontics and a master’s degree.

image.alt: Dr. Daniel Camacho headshot

paragraphs.text: Dr. Camacho is Board Certified by the American Board of Orthodontics and maintains memberships with the American Association of Orthodontists and multiple regional and state dental societies. He has completed advanced training including an Invisalign<sup>®</sup> fellowship and the Pitts 21 Master’s Course, and he remains active in continuing education.

image.alt: Dr. Daniel Camacho professional portrait

paragraphs.text: During his training Dr. Camacho earned multiple scholarships and published in peer-reviewed journals. He was appointed the youngest adjunct professor at his institution and continues to contribute to research and teaching in orthodontics.

image.alt: Dr. Daniel Camacho in clinical setting

paragraphs.text: Outside the office Dr. Camacho competes in local tennis and pickleball, enjoys beach workouts, and travels frequently to Colombia where he volunteers at the orphanage his family runs. He values community service and looks forward to giving back one smile at a time.

image.alt: Dr. Daniel Camacho smiling

items.name: Pricilia
items.bio: With 14 years in orthodontics, Pricilia manages treatment logistics and financial coordination and brings an active, positive approach to patient care.

image.alt: Pricilia, Treatment & Financial Coordinator

items.name: Monica
items.bio: Monica brings 25 years of clinical and administrative dental experience, a dental degree from Colombia, and a background in emergency medical response and education.

image.alt: Monica, Administrative Coordinator

og_meta.description: Forever Smiles Orthodontics provides esthetic, evidence-based, patient-centered orthodontic care in Fort Lauderdale led by Dr. Daniel Camacho.

image.alt: Smiling young girl in a bright orthodontic office

Get Started.title: What to expect at your first visit

paragraphs.text: Your free consultation begins with a warm welcome from our team and a chance to share your concerns and goals. We’ll take digital photos and a low-dose, preliminary x-ray so Dr. Camacho can see a complete view of your teeth and bite, then perform a thorough orthodontic exam and explain the options that best fit your needs.

Most patients fall into one of three categories: no treatment needed now, treatment recommended but not yet, or treatment recommended and ready now. If treatment can wait, we’ll schedule an observation visit. If you decide to start, we often reserve time to begin treatment the same day so you can walk out ready to move forward.

image.alt: Parent and child checking in at a dental reception desk

paragraphs.text: We accept most major insurance plans and will file your claims electronically for your convenience.

We offer flexible, in-house, interest-free financing. Many patients start with down payments around $250 and monthly payments often below $200. Treatment cost varies by case, typically from about $2,000 for shorter Invisalign<sup>®</sup> cases to $10,000 for complex care.
Use our payment calculator to explore options: https://foreversmilesortho.com/lp/payment-calculator/

Before your visit, please complete our appointment request using the WPForms form. The request collects name, phone, email, and whether you are a new or existing patient. reCAPTCHA is enabled for security; Google Privacy and Terms apply.

image.alt: Patient completing health history forms on a tablet
Family enjoying time together outside

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at the practice

paragraphs.text: While braces have been a staple of orthodontics for decades, our appliances are anything but outdated. In recent years, these appliances have been optimized for maximum efficiency with a more discreet appearance. We offer braces as a trusted corrective treatment to provide consistently beautiful results tailored to each patient’s needs and goals.

image.alt: Smiling family enjoying time together

paragraphs.text: Metal braces are a long‑standing, highly efficient option. They use brackets bonded to the teeth and stainless steel wires that are adjusted over time to move teeth into place. Our approach blends established research with modern techniques to make treatment reliable and well managed.

image.alt: Dental checkup with metal braces

paragraphs.text: Ceramic braces use tooth‑colored brackets for a more discreet appearance while delivering effective tooth movement. They function similarly to metal braces, though ceramic brackets can be slightly less durable, so care with hard or sticky foods is advised.

image.alt: Patient smiling with ceramic braces

paragraphs.text: Pitts 21 self-ligating brackets use a unique clip system to hold the archwire, which can reduce friction and in many cases shorten treatment time. This modern bracket‑and‑wire approach is selected for patients who may benefit from a more efficient tooth‑movement protocol.

image.alt: Two stylish teens smiling with braces

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> uses a series of clear, removable aligners made from 3D imaging of your mouth. Each set of aligners applies controlled pressure to shift teeth, and patients typically change to a new set every one to two weeks. Aligners are virtually invisible and removable for eating, sports, and oral hygiene.
Comprehensive Invisalign can treat crowding, bite issues, gaps and more. Treatment timelines vary by case; many patients complete care within one to two years depending on complexity.

image.alt: Close-up of clear aligner being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Angel Aligners are custom clear aligner trays made with advanced 3D technology and high-performance, flexible materials. They offer a discreet, removable option that often delivers comfortable wear and can shorten treatment time for suitable cases.

image.alt: 3D treatment planning software showing orthodontic simulation

paragraphs.text: Retainers preserve the results of treatment. We offer both removable clear retainers and fixed bonded options, and we provide guidance to help you maintain long‑term stability. If a retainer is lost, we can often provide a replacement quickly.

image.alt: Young woman holding orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: Our smile design process combines diagnostic imaging, esthetic goals, and evidence‑based techniques to craft a personalized plan. Whether a limited or comprehensive approach is required, we focus on creating balanced, long‑lasting results that match each patient’s features.

image.alt: Modern dental office interior with advanced technology
Family enjoying time together outside

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about retainers, smile design, treatment options, and how to schedule with Forever Smiles Orthodontics.

accordion.header: What if I lose my retainer?

paragraphs.text: It’s common for people to lose a retainer, for example, by accidentally throwing it in the trash after a meal. Fortunately, the team at Forever Smiles Orthodontics makes it easy to get a new retainer so you can protect your smile. If you’ve already been fitted for a retainer at one of their offices, they offer same-day delivery for new retainers.

image.alt: Happy Family Portrait

accordion.header: Can I get a retainer if I got treatment from another orthodontist?

paragraphs.text: Absolutely. The Forever Smiles Orthodontics team is happy to accept patients who received treatment at a different orthodontist’s office and need a replacement retainer. After a quick fitting at the office, they provide you with the clear, comfortable retainer you need to maintain your smile results. Get your retainer and protect your smile by calling either Forever Smiles Orthodontics office or making an appointment online today.

image.alt: Couple Enjoying Time Together

paragraphs.text: Forever Smiles Orthodontics uses a personalized smile design to ensure each patient gets the best aesthetic results possible. The team takes pride in delivering stunning smiles for each individual who comes in for orthodontic treatment.

Both offices see fewer patients than many other orthodontic practices. This allows your provider to spend more time with you to discuss your smile concerns and the changes you’d like to see. Then, they design your ideal smile and put together a treatment plan that helps achieve it.

image.alt: Collaborative Team Spirit Moment

accordion.header: How does smile design work and what treatment options are used?

paragraphs.text: It depends on what you need to reach your dream smile. At Forever Smiles Orthodontics, each smile design — and the accompanying treatment — is personalized. The process starts with a diagnostic process, during which your provider identifies the obstacles standing between you and your smile goals. Then they create a treatment plan to help you overcome those obstacles.

For some patients, limited treatment applied to a specific problem area for a short time is sufficient to give that person their ideal smile. Others need more involved treatment. Even if you do need comprehensive treatment with braces, don’t worry. Forever Smiles Orthodontics uses Smile Arc Protection (SAP) bracket placement protocols to optimize the aesthetic results of your treatment. The team also offers the latest in orthodontic advancements like ceramic brackets for less visibility or self-ligating Pitts 21™ brackets so you don’t have to worry about elastics with your braces.

To find out what your smile design treatment might entail, make an appointment at Forever Smiles Orthodontics. The dedicated team of experts talks with you about your treatment options to design your ideal smile.

image.alt: Smiling Man Working at Desk

accordion.header: How long does smile design take?

paragraphs.text: It only takes one appointment at Forever Smiles Orthodontics to get your smile design and learn what dedicated orthodontics can do for you. Your provider explains your treatment options and how long each one takes. At every turn, they apply the latest in evidence-based orthodontics to give you long-lasting, aesthetically pleasing results as quickly as possible.

image.alt: Mother and Daughter Smiling Together
Family enjoying time together outside
